alert.note: Alert for Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 27 at 10:36PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST FELICIANA, CENTRAL POINTE COUPEE PARISHES IN SOUTHEASTERN LOUISIANA AND SOUTH CENTRAL WILKINSON COUNTIES THROUGH 1130 PM CDT... At 1036 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Fort Adams, or 15 miles northwest of St. Francisville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Roads, St. Francisville, Morganza, Wakefield, Spillman, and Batchelor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
